pros:
When I came to work for Microsoft over 3 years ago, I thought it was my dream company, and 3 years later the company lives up to my expectations entirely! The biggest pros of working here from my perspective are:
1. Extremely professional yet relaxed environment
2. Huge impact of job you do (user base of 1 million is an "emerging product", we think in 10s and 100s of millions)
3. Good and consistent work-life balance (especially in Norway: time with family is YOUR time, and it is protected very well...)
4. Great handling of WFH during covid
5. People rarely leave and only do so with a very good reason and normally after staying in company for many years, so it is safe to make friends (if you've been to startups, you might know what I mean! :D)
cons:
1. Career growth may be perceived as slow (it does not get any faster than 1 promotion per year, and for most it is 1 promotion per 1.5 years)
2. Salaries are not insanely high (we're slightly above market in Oslo, but the job we do is waaay above market in Oslo...)
3. Things may be perceived as generally slow (well, we're over 150k people at the moment of writing, after all...)

Still, none of these cons could make me drop a star. I have been having a great time since day 1 and will likely keep doing so for maaany years to come :)

review_title: Microsoft Global Delivery - A Career black hole
pros:
Technically still a part of Microsoft, so global benefits are applicable to MS-GD associates like 
1. Access to a vast learning repository and internal knowledge bank build on the experiences of some of the best and known names in industry.
2. Excellent facilities and transport , admin team will go to any lengths to ensure that you are not troubled.
3. Access to people from other time zone and domains.( conditions applied )
4. Work with some of the best talented and visionary people in the world.
5. Brand name, although it's been eroding since last 2 years in domestic hiring market.( it does not stands in front of the FANG competitors and generally does not gives you an advantage )
cons:
Cons of Microsoft as a whole
- Huge company, so it's easy to be lost. Imposter syndrome is real here.
- MSFT management and LT is known to be slow, political and pathological in the wider industry circle, with poor grasp of what market wants. A lot of innovative steps are axed due to internal politics, only to be picked up competition and made a market success.

Cons of MS-GD
 - This is career Literal black hole. You will join 2 levels lower than a college fresher Developer in India, irrespective of your lateral experience. the result is that you will receive stocks up to 5-6 years later than a fresher engineer in iDC.
- Lateral hiring will set you back by 5-6 years in terms of career growth.
- The management here is Pathological and one can find traces of nepotism, narcissistic & predatory behavior in various layers of leadership.
- Your promotion depends not on what kind of work you do or how you have enabled the organization to grow, but how well you mesh with LT/Managers and how you have enabled them to grow in their own silo.
- Your manager who has no visibility into your work is responsible for your appraisal and growth within your local practice. While your peers who have seen - Your work quality have no say. The person responsible for project cannot affect or contribute to your success.
- Success criteria have become a tangled complex web of responsibilities that even your LT will be unable to answer. A consultant is responsible to deliver all the added target endpoints while meeting a 1600+ hours a year of utilization.
- You are responsible for your career growth, consumption metrics, project utilization etc, while also doing the work your manager is supposed to do.
- Your manager will not help you in your career growth. You will be lucky if your manager stays with you for even 10-11 months. Invariably, you will experience a manager change every year and have to deal with the headache of dealing with new style, expectations and forced suggestions while handling your daily stress of work.
- Burnout and mental distress is real here. LT will advertise mental health as important, but you will be reprimanded for taking leaves or timeout. In fact, covid crisis has demonstrated where managers have asked people to continue work even after tragic events in their life.
- WLB is non-existent here. You are responsible for your WLB while ensuring delivery targets. Every project you go in will be understaffed, under budget and either in yellow or red state.
